title: Ruben Loftus-Cheek 'close' to Chelsea return after stepping up recovery from injury nightmare
text:
Chelsea star Ruben Loftus-Cheek has vowed to come back 'stronger and sharper' after five-month injury lay-off.

The 23-year-old midfielder ruptured his achilles during the end-of-season friendly with New England Revolution in May.

Loftus-Cheek revealed he had suffered a setback which had delayed his return but he was now 'close' to getting back on the pitch.

Chelsea midfielder Ruben Loftus-Cheek (centre) ruptured his achilles during a friendly in May

The England international has opened up about the injury in a video he posted on Instagram

Loftus-Cheek said he has had to 'learn how to walk again' after the severe injury in May

Speaking to WOWHYDRATE, he said: 'I've actually had a few setbacks that have put me behind which has been quite frustrating to be honest,' he added.

'I've had to learn to walk again and I've only just got pain free but for sure I'm going to come back stronger, sharper and do whatever I can to be in better shape.

'Before I got injured I was playing my best football. I've missed feeling tired from running, from hard work, that feeling of being in a game again.

'Everything I've been working towards is for the feeling of stepping back onto that pitch again and I'm ready to go.'

Loftus-Cheek has vowed to come back 'stronger and sharper' after five-month injury lay-off

It has been a long five months for Loftus-Cheek since suffering the injury.

He added: 'When it happened I turned and pushed off and I heard a clap, it was really loud and I thought someone had smashed me from behind. The referee gave a free kick, he blew the whistle so he must have been close to me, but watching the tape back nobody was near me.

'To lift my leg up took maximum effort, with a big injury it's really hard, you don't see a difference everyday, you don't wake up and think it's a lot better every morning, it's over a period of time. It's more exciting the closer I get to making my comeback, the more I keep pushing I will be there soon.

'When you have a good day you get excited, getting that much closer to getting back on the pitch again playing football, getting back in the gym and pushing it, so we will see how it goes.'

The 23-year-old can be seen working out during the video as he attempts to get back to fitness
